template.name: GREEDY ALGORITHM FOR SCHEDULING LECTURES BY SOFT CONSTRAINT OPTIMIZATION FOR COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING, KNUST
template.about: An implementation of a greedy algorithm in Java which schedules lectures into a workable weekly timetable, taking into consideration a weighted number of soft constraints including the comfort of lecturers and students and the distance between lecture halls. This project solves an NP-hard problem and is set to replace the manual method of scheduling currently employed. This project is still in testing but has so far reduced the time taken for creating workable timetables for the College of Engineering at Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology from 1 week to 1 minute. The front end was built from scratch in Typescript with React and Tailwind CSS.

projects.name: WOPRI
projects.about: A trivia quiz game developed as a Progressive Web Application (PWA). Built with performance and user experience in mind, it was personal experiment on accessibility and extreme optimization for PWAs. It has a Lighthouse performance rating of 99%.

projects.name: SHANNONIZER
projects.about: In information theory, the entropy of a random variable is the average level of "information", "surprise", or "uncertainty" inherent in the variable's possible outcomes. The concept of information entropy was introduced by Claude Shannon in his 1948 paper "A Mathematical Theory of Communication", and is sometimes called Shannon entropy in his honor. Shannonizer is a Python program for calculating self-information or average information (entropy) of an event or series of events in bits.
